p: While the number of ICU SARI admissions always peaked in winter, the weekly average APACHE IV score in the patients admitted was relatively stable and did not show winter peaks (Additional file 1). This was also confirmed by low correlation between the two ( R 2 0.04, p value 0.41). Mortality in SARI within the ICU did show seasonality, with higher mortality in winter, visually coinciding with peaks in SARI admissions ( R 2 0.64, p value <0.0001) (Fig. 1).
